intro: Borreria gracilis, commonly known as slender borreria, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in open woodlands and disturbed soils. Borreria gracilis is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant.
